biospec_descr.textblock: No biospecimens are to be retained.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of our study was to evaluate the reliability of uncalibrated cardiac index
      monitoring based on arterial waveform analysis in patients undergoing off-pump coronary
      artery bypass grafting.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reliability of Cardiac Output Monitoring Based on Uncalibrated Pulse Contour Analysis

detailed_description.textblock:
Using contemporary statistical method the cardiac index values obtained via uncalibrated
      pulse contour analysis with Pro AQT system will be compared with traditional transpulmonary
      thermodilution technique (Pulsion, Germany).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  elective off-pump coronary artery bypass grafting

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age < 18 and > 80 years,

          -  preoperative ejection fraction < 0.35,

          -  severe cardiac valve dysfunction or peripheral vascular disease,

          -  constant atrial fibrillation,

          -  simultaneous interventions (carotid endarterectomy, aneurysm repair, etc.),

          -  transfer to cardiopulmonary bypass.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with coronary artery disease, ranked ASA II-III and scheduled for elective
        off-pump coronary artery bypass grafting

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Reliability of Cardiac Output Monitoring Based on Uncalibrated Pulse Contour Analysis During Off-pump Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

oversight_info.authority: Russia: Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation

primary_outcome.description: Accuracy and precision of cardiac index measurement using uncalibrated pulse contour analysis in comparison with transpulmonary thermodilution

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
